review_text: The location is a separate building behind the main house. A nice touch is the motion-activated lighting that comes on at night as you enter the backyard to walk to your accommodation. The refrigerator had beverages and a snack, the freezer had breakfast sandwiches and the bathroom stocked with shampoo, soap, toothbrushes, Q-tips, etc. Jose responded promptly to the only message I sent him during my stay. My only complaint is that there was no cable TV. My college's football team had a bowl game starting 15 minutes after my check-in. I did have a laptop with me and Jose's brother helped me hook the laptop up to the TV with an HDMI cable. I had to purchase access to ESPN+ but I was able to watch the game.

review_text:
Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. Booked this guest house for superbowl weekend. It was an easy ride to downtown tampa and the riverfront/surrounding areas. Jose was very responsive with pre-check in. His mother is so sweet!
The only downside to this is the guest house is inside their backyard. It is down a path and seems secluded from the main space, but you do have to walk past the main house into the backyard consistently to get to and from the guest suite.
With that being said, I never felt a lack of privacy when at the suite. The owners of the main house were there and attentive for questions but Erin I felt let you have your space otherwise which was wonderful.
The suite itself was extremely clean, and well stocked for guests. The pictures are really the exact layout of the space which was nice to know what to expect!
I would definitely stay here again.

Eddie and his wife are incredibly nice and helpful hosts. They checked in on me often to make sure I had everything I needed. The above-garage suite was absolutely stunning inside. the design, functionality, and space is perfect for a work trip or vacation for 1 or a couple. The suite is fully stocked with kitchen items, coffee machine, and a fridge. The nicest touch was the extra toiletries in the bathroom in case you run out of your personal items!
Make sure to head to the neighborhood pizza and wings hot spot, Lee's Grocery! Just a short walk from the apartment.
All around a 10/10 experience; can't wait to book with Eddie again the next time I'm in Tampa!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
As a returning guest and self-proclaimed Airbnb aficionado, I am delighted to report that Eddie and his bona fide backyard oasis have truly done it again!
This beautiful well-appointed home-away-from-home boasts an elegant and sophisticated upgrade from your stereotypical vacation rental.
The property’s comfort, cleanliness, and tastefully curated décor are indicative of our host’s tireless commitment to a superlative guest experience. Eddie’s concierge-like attentiveness can be seen everywhere from the luxurious linens and perfectly fluffed pillows to the fully stocked, ensuite coffee bar.
What's more, this guest home’s ideal location exceeds my every want and need. Situated near the epicenter of downtown Tampa, guests are only ever a stone’s throw from the city’s best bars, restaurants, and nightlife.
I would unequivocally recommend prospective travelers to Tampa leave their visit in Eddie’s capable hands -- lest they run the risk of having missed one of Tampa's hidden gems.

name: Tucker
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Welcome to AirBnB Nirvana. Yep, this IS the place …the quintessential case-study of everything the "21st century sharing economy" promised to deliver us ...a truly idyllic home away from home; effortlessly delivered and seamlessly executed; hosted by a wonderful family you'd like to adopt as your very own :) This is peer-to-peer perfection come to life -- elegantly personified by your gracious host, Eddie. Ok, so you want details?! Hmm, let's see …how about the perfectly 'invisible' concierge-quality service and attention (Eddie is politely imperceptible until you want something; and then he springs to action like the proprietor of a luxury 5-Star European hotel); or the chic décor; luxurious bedding; impeccable cleanliness; perfect climate control; the quiet serenity of an enchanted tree-lined neighborhood; and so forth. Suffice it to say that when you dream of your perfect home away from home in Tampa, it is the images of Eddie’s heavenly habitat that are sure to dance in your head.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The place itself was decent for the most part. Nice little kitchen, bedroom and small bathroom. All in all, it wasn't a terrible stay as there were some decent amenities and so on (Shampoo, Conditioner and body wash in the shower/Spare sheets in the bedroom/AC unit).
My only gripe was how loud it was for most of the stay. There are chickens somewhere near by? I was consistently woken up by the sound of a Rooster calling out in the morning somewhere nearby. There was also the fact that the host or her husband (?) would play music relatively loudly at night, and it made it difficult to fall asleep some nights. All in all, it was an alright stay for the price but I can't exactly say I'd prioritize this place if I were to visit Tampa again.

Rating, 4 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Pros:
Host is responsive, provided us with stuff needed when asked.
Has a private entrance to the guest house
Allowed me to check in early
Cons:
On the weekend, it was a lot of noise coming from outside all night up to 4am. The guesthouse has thin walls, which got annoying and hard to sleep at night. There is also a rooster that will sing at 3am everyday.
AC is not steady, warm water in the bathroom.
One day a car was parked on our side of parking which did not allow to park the car. We had speak with the owners of house which they just told us to go around it and park in front of it.
Trash can lid stays fully open. If you leave trash for a certain amount of time, it can leave a smell around the whole area
Overall I would recommend this place if it's for a short stay, but not for long period of time.

Dear Lidi and Carlos,
I wanted to take a moment to express my heartfelt gratitude for the incredible experience I had staying at your Airbnb apartment in Rocky Point, Tampa. Your commitment to excellence was evident from the moment I stepped into your beautifully maintained home. The cleanliness of the apartment was truly commendable, creating a welcoming and comfortable environment for a stay of over a month.
Every amenity I could have needed was thoughtfully provided, ensuring a hassle free living experience for one month stay. The attention to detail in the amenities offered not only added convenience to my stay but also made it feel like a home away from home.
Thank you for making my long stay in Tampa not just comfortable, but truly memorable. Your hospitality has set a high bar, and I look forward to recommending your apartment to friends and family planning a visit to the area.
Thanks & Best Regards,
Nilabdhi Samantray

review_text: Location to bayshore, Hyde park village, channel side and the highways can’t be beat at Anna’s spot. Her condo is very clean and cozy. Large rooms, comfortable furniture, and nice TVs makes this a great spot to unwind. Our only complaints are being on the bottom floor we expected some noise since it’s an older home with wooden floors, but anytime someone walks upstairs you will know it. It’s very loud. I’d suggest asking to stay in a room upstairs if silence is golden to you. Also, my husband mentioned several times about the round, tiny toilet. But, other than that, the spot is absolutely precious and all the little extras like coffee, cream, bottled water, sugar, shampoo and conditioner were all wonderful touches. There are lots and lots of good things about Anna’s spot.

name: Laura
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Location. Location. Location. Nice apartment in a great location. Near downtown Tampa and near Hyde Park. Easy drive to lots of shopping and restaurants. About two blocks away from the water. Beautiful walk along the water! Easy access to highways to get to other locations in Tampa and St. Pete. The apartment in on the first floor of an older house, possibly historic craftsman style, that has been divided into 4 apartments. There is a nice front porch. The apartment was larger than expected. Some things in the apartment have been updated. It has the basics in the kitchen and a large dinning table. All wood floors that look to be the original and they are beautiful but if you are not used to it be prepared for the squeaks. The living room is large and has a pull out couch. Not a lot of comfortable seating. Very simple. Bedroom is also large, big bed and has a tv. Plenty of closet space. Bathroom is small. Sink area and floor tile have been updated; tub has not. TIPS if you rent: The AC is on a set schedule, so you may have to reset it a couple times while you are in the apartment. You touch the outside of the circle to increase or decrease the temperature. The front door leads to the entry way to the building that leads to the door to the apartment. The entry is by touch pad and you have to push/touch the top of the key pad to lock it when you leave and turn the knob behind you once you are inside. Overall would recommend!

review_text:
Anna was a nice host, easy to communicate with.
The house is super charming and cute. On one of the previous reviews someone complained about the floor planks lifting. This house is a much older home (which is what gives it the charm factor) and the floors are original, (which I hope they keep as long as they can. The floors give the entire place that nostalgic character) so they will not be perfect. That shouldn’t be an expectation
Place was bigger and more spacious than how it looks in the photos.
Perfect location and a 1 minute walk to the Bayshore on the water.
For the price I was expecting there to be a few more things provided like coffee, laundry detergent etc.
but that was more minor for me, but I would have liked to know that beforehand.
Bathtub needs a little love / replaced but was still doable to shower in
Parking wasn’t an issue at all - parked out front every-time
I would totally stay here again, I really loved it

Pros: Great location, friendly and communicative host, comfy bed, ample space for working remote, affordable rate.
Cons: The apartment needs some TLC…bathroom especially was in pretty rough shape. Pictures made it look better than it was in person. Some of the floor boards would also sink down when stepped on so we had to watch our steps. Nest thermostat was touchy and would turn to 75 degrees during the night which caused us to wake up uncomfortably warm (it was 90-100 degrees outside during our stay plus humidity).

Rating, 4 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Excellent location, walkable to many restaurants and Riverwalk which we loved. Felt safe in the building and I liked the community room with coffee and a place to work from even though we were only there for a week.
Being in downtown, it was noisy especially early mornings and the apartment was facing the Straz center of performing arts so there was lot of light coming into the apartment at night from the lights on the buildings so I would suggest management installs room darkening shades especially in the bedroom since it was too bright even with the blinds. I slept with AirPods even at night to avoid waking up to sounds early morning.
Parking was included in their garage which was great, however the parking spaces are too narrow and I can imagine dents in car doors while opening and closing the doors. Residents were mostly younger and drive very fast in the garage so need to lookout for that. We had trouble getting in and out of the garage on the 1st day but was resolved quickly.

review_text: Not a single bad thing could be said about this place!!!! I had a long, 14 day stay and while the cost certainly added up for just a solo traveler, I had NO regrets on splurging! SO much to do in Tampa and in just a .5 walk you can find yourself at the trolley to go even further. Maggie was able to get me a parking pass for my car which was amazing! Lots of amenities (while the lobby espresso machine seemed to fail everyone at points, haha!), got some work done daily on the 6th floor lounge and spent my evenings looking out at the city skyline on the 8th floor. Tampa is such a beautiful city and you will not regret choosing this Airbnb :)

,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
My wife and I greatly enjoyed our stay at Ave. While apartment is small, we absolutely loved the amenities offered. There is a nice, heated pool. The gym rivals ones with paid memberships. There is plenty of open space to relax or meet outside of your room. I worked remotely for a week and found the co working space to be top notch (conference room, wifi printer etc.)
Ave is very centrally located and is very walkabout to area restaurants and the riverwalk etc. There are also bikes available in the lobby.
My one small feedback would be that the initial supplies offered are not at the level I am accustomed to at Air Bnbs. (ie. a soap for a single load for the dishwater). We did an instacart order on our 1st day for these items.
All and all, this is a great apartment, in a great building, in a great location. We look forward to our return.
-MC

Listing pictures and the room may not match, they have various furnished apartments. The kitchen is stocked except for providing k-cups (often done at other airbnbs). There’s a great patio to catch the sunset. The pool is centrally located so short hours of direct sunlight. They provide plenty of towels.
Overall this was great!

review_text:
I stayed 3 weeks at AVE, so I spent a good amount of time there. The amenities were top notch. I have 2 big dogs, that I took to the beach numerous times, so the doggy spa was used several times. The coffee lounge was super convenient, and the roof-deck is beautiful.
The pool is pretty shaded, as it is in courtyard, so don't expect to lay out much there, but it is a nice pool nonetheless. The gym is nice, and well equipped. Overall the amenities are what makes the place. In addition, it is easy to get around, the highway is right there, the riverwalk is convenient, etc.
The ONLY negative I can give really, is that there was no private outdoor space. The listing said private patio/balcony, but my unit did not have any of that. Outside of that, the place was super convenient, and I was happy with my stay overall.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Overall we would return, GREAT facility. Only issue was we were one of three groups renting, all of us requested a 1 bedroom unit and all of us got different floor configurations. Ave advertises a queen bed, we thought is was a double or mini-queen. The two couples in our group did get the queen configuration (different floor layout). The single person in our group got a configuration with a king bed, balcony, walk through closet from the bedroom to the bathroom. Logically it would seem that one of the couples get the king bed configuration, but Ave said it was all random. When they do not advertise king beds it does not mean they do not have them. Again, great facility, we would definitely go back the next time we are in Tampa.

review_text:
Ava’s place was in a great location. I was able to walk to the convention centre everyday and find lots of places to eat and grab a drink. She is located right along the river walk which is beautiful and close to some neat spots to check out at night. I was able to reach someone anytime I had a question. There is someone working at the front desk which I found very helpful to answer questions and direct us on how to get into the building , find parking, etc. The amenities were wonderful, including free coffee on the 5th floor, a pool and workout facilities.The only thing missing was dish soap and hand soap. The lady at the front desk explained that they were all out and couldn’t provide any. We also ate most of our meals at the condo and only had 1 package of detergent to do dishes. It would be helpful to have dish soap available to be able to hand wash some dishes.
Overall this was a beautiful condo and would be worth staying at again.

We appreciated the great views from the patio, a fun pool and especially the small restaurant and bar at the pool which we frequented! The parking was easy enough and location was so close to the airport! One suggestion we had for improvement was better couches in the living room. They were incredibly uncomfortable to sleep on, thankfully my kids are easygoing but they really were not sleepable. They were very hard, you could feel the rods in them and that is something easy enough to switch out. If you are planning on using those two couches as additional beds, might not recommend counting on good sleep. overall it met all of our needs and had a great experience.

Shortly after we got there we saw stingrays swimming down in the bay and we loved watching them every night! Very peaceful location and we enjoyed the live music from across the bay at whiskey joes! The pool was also nice and warm so we could swim with our littles even though it wasn’t very warm out or sunny. We’ll keep this place in mind when we come back to Tampa!

The place itself was nice, nothing fancy but had everything we needed. The bed was comfortable. Nice wall mounted TV in both the living area and bedroom. The couches were not very comfortable, but we really didn't spend much time inside during our short stay. Sunset was beautiful. Was a great stay.

review_text:
The view from the place is perfect. We stayed to be close to the amphitheater, downtown Tampa and have a short drive to the beach. It’s exactly as described. The owner is very responsive. Very helpful with any requests or needs.
The place has everything you need. And the location has a food place and area to hangout for sunset. We even saw a baby shark in the bay from our balcony.
Only small cons… The futon to watch TV is a little hard so we sat on pillows and the queen bed is very firm. If you’re good with firm you are fine. One night the neighbors were super loud and the bedroom is located near the hall so you hear a lot and my white noise wasn’t as helpful. There is a noise ordinance for 11pm but the neighbors in the other units didn’t care. So one night was harder to sleep bc of the noise and firm bed. I don’t want to post anything neg but I just want to make sure peeps are fully informed. I hate posting neg bc the owners are clearly great and so is the place but I need sleep.

The Bonus I would say is that it's a straight shot over to Clearwater beach, only 20 mins if leaving early in the morning. We left at 730 and by 8 we were already sitting down having breakfast. Our only regret was that this was only a quick trip for us and we could stay longer.

After a long day of traveling it was great to see some snacks and bottles of water for us. The view was beautiful! We could sit on the balcony and watch stingrays and fish in the water. We enjoyed the beach area of the complex... watching the sunset, playing on the beach after the tiki torches were lit at night. The pool was heated which was so nice! It was pretty crowded at first but we were able to return later and swim while listening to a man playing the steel drum by the pool. The condo was very clean. Great location... easily caught an Uber from the airport to the condo and then from the condo to the cruise port the next day. Would definitely stay here again when in the area!

name: Helen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Great location — within 20 minutes of PIE airport (St. Pete’s/Clearwater) and even closer to Tampa Airport — but still feels far away from the city in that you get to look out into the water and feel surrounded by nature.
My husband and I and our 10-years old daughter stayed here for 3 nights and it was perfect for us. It’s a cozy space — quiet and peaceful for sleeping. We enjoyed quiet mornings as well, fixing our own breakfast and drinking tea/coffee on the deck.
Most of the days were spent out exploring the Tampa Zoo (so cool) and spending time with local friends. The first night, though, we got in tired from delays in travel and had a nice dinner at the simple bar/restaurant next to the pool. It was relaxing to not have to go out and find food once we got settled in.
The hosts were friendly and responsive. They had okayed an early check-in for us, and although we didn’t get to take advantage of it since our flight from MSP was delayed, I still appreciated their flexibility.

We’ve loved staying at Airbnb’s to be more in a central area, with personalized fun things to do and with a little more personal amenities (e.g. creamer). That said, I’m sure they would have responded immediately if I had reached out.

Hotel office also has a great selection of food, drinks and must haves when traveling. Fish, stingray and the occasional dolphin sightings were just a look over the balcony away. Pricey but spectacular restaurants/bars within a mile walking or driving distance. No issues at all walking 6-7 miles to check out the area throughout the weekend and we felt very safe the whole stay. Very family friendly place. Can’t wait to come back!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Lovely short 3-day adventure for my 50th birthday. Location on the river was peaceful, private, and very relaxing. Did not get to take advantage of the all the amenities due to our short stay. Location is very close the Busch Gardens and Tampa Zoo. Just a short drive to the Florida Aquarium and Riverwalk area. We also drove to Clearwater beach for a day trip which only took about 30 minutes and was easy to find.
Wifi did not work while we were there, and hosts did all they possibly could to try to get it fixed while we were still there, very communicative. This was not a major issue since we tried to stay off the internet, and just enjoy the peacefulness of the surroundings.
As Waze took us into the neighborhood, it initially appeared a little shady at first, but as we approached the rental we quickly felt safe, and discovered a better route to take to and from the rivershed for the rest of our stay.
Would stay here again in a heartbeat next time we are in Tampa.

After day two we started mentioning we wish we would have planned less so we could spend more time at the River Shed. lol Having coffee on the porch or dock in the mornings was definitely a huge highlight of our trip. We really hope we can find an excuse to come back soon. By the way, we highly recommend: The Getaway (St. Pete- for drinks, and relaxing by the water), Dang Dude (Sparkman Wharf- great Asian food), Ulele (Tampa- fancy dinner), Colombia (Ybor- fancy lunch), and Grand Cathedral Cigars (Ybor- cigars. lol)

The 1 & only thing that would have made this absolutely perfect was the water temperature in the shower :( my boyfriend and I are hot water lovers and it just didn’t get ~hot~
But other than that, I promise you literally every single aspect and detail of the house is absolutely perfect. So stunning! I think I spent the entire trip on the back porch. It’s exactly what you would expect and more. I didn’t ever want to leave. The bed was so comfy and soft and there are so many amenities.
Carey and Aaron are SO accommodating, they respond quickly and checked in to make sure we had everything we needed.

The room was very spacious and the interior design really felt like home away from home but still very cozy. Carey and her daughter were super sweet. They brought me my groceries on the first day since the shopper had left them outside. She was super understanding about adjusting my checkout time since my departure train got delayed. I honestly wish I could live there. The neighborhood is super safe since I went on walks a few of the days. Even the neighbors were super friendly. The kitchen had to be my favorite part ! Mattress was so heavenly not to mention the hammock and the fan since Florida is known for the heat ! Loved it here and definitely will be back.

Excellent location; short drive to downtown Tampa without the clutter of the city traffic and congestion. The bed was comfy, plenty of towels provided and kitchen had everything we needed.
It was magical to kayak/canoe with the manatees and watch all of the birds and squirrels up close on the porch and the dock.
We really enjoyed our stay and recommend to anyone who is looking for a place to relax and unwind.

The inside was spotless, the bed was VERY comfortable and I actually took pictures of the bathroom because we liked the layout and the tile so much. We will absolutely be back to Tampa again soon, and will pass this place along as a recommendation to others we know! The hosts were incredible and SUPER responsive. They were so accommodating and allowed us an earlier check-in, which made our whole day. Thanks so much Carey + Aaron!

I misunderstood and thought the dock was a little bit more private, but you do walk through their backyard as shown in pictures to get to it. There was a musty smell especially after we came in from the outdoors. Water pressure and temperature in the shower could be stronger/hotter. There’s not a lot of privacy in the bathroom due to a barn door that has some openings. TV is the size of a computer screen. The bonus is that you are close to everything in Tampa and there’s so much to do there! Owners are also kind enough to offer their canoe to use during your stay.

review_text:
We LOVED this BEAUTIFUL space!! When we first arrived I was caught off guard; I knew we would be on the river, but I guess I didn't realize the actual proximity to it! I felt like I was walking into a tree house.... If you enjoy nature, THIS IS THE PLACE. We spent a lot of our trip just sitting out on the porch... watching butterflies, alligators, fish, & dolphins go by. We enjoyed trying to identify our sightings with the thoughtful books/brochures on local wildlife that were provided.
The space was cozy, but not cramped. Perfect for a couple. Honestly, we were so content it was hard to get motivated to leave the Airbnb!
We did have a few super minor technical difficulties during our stay, which I'm really only mentioning to highlight that Carey & Aaron were excellent at communicating with us and resolving in an extremely timely manner (thank you!).
Hosts were accommodating, responsive, & friendly... going out of their way to ensure our stay was perfect with recommendations & allowing us to utilize some of their outdoor recreations. We appreciate you & were so happy we got to say hi & THANK YOU!

When I first stepped foot inside, my jaw dropped. I was blown away by how clean and beautiful the place was. I loved the way the place was decorated too. It made you feel welcomed and right at home. The back screened-in porch was one of my favorite features because even in the rain, I could be outside and enjoy the nature surrounding me. My only regret is not spending MORE time here. Will for sure come back and recommend to anybody looking for a private place with a taste of nature while still being close to anything you need in town.

It felt just far enough from the city for some peace and just close enough to get everywhere we needed! Driving to the beach, into the city, Busch gardens - we never had to go farther than 15 minutes! The place is so cozy and comfortable. I have no complaints. We will definitely be back here when we come to Tampa. I would recommend this for anyone - family, couple, solo-traveler.

(Our car was full of our daughter's stuff so we showed up with nothing of our own really - so the amenities were very very appreciated.) Our hosts were available for any issues that might come up but we had total privacy. And bonus, we got to meet their dog. <3 Would definitely stay here again.

Of course we saw some other sites but always ended our day trips with pleas to go back to the Airbnb! The Jungalow was the perfect spot to enjoy some pool/spa time but also walk over to SOHO and other spots in Hyde Park. We loved eating at several of the great restaurants on S Howard street and enjoyed some nice morning runs along Bayshore Boulevard. The Jungalow was super clean, very well-designed, and the hosts were super helpful and responsive. I don’t think we could have asked for a better place for our mini spring break trip!

Would 100% stay here and recommend again!

The bed and bedding were so incredible I could have slept for days (in fact it was so good I'm going to try to replicate it at my own house!). Highly recommend, and I cannot wait to stay here again!

review_text: Excellent location, pristine home, squeaky clean, plenty of space, comfortable beds, great furniture but the traffic and trains were too loud for me to enjoy sitting outside. The weather was perfect (other than the pollen which is nobody’s fault) so I really wanted to enjoy sitting out on the front porch and have my morning coffee but I found the drone of traffic to be too much so I would go inside. I sleep deep so the cars and occasional train didn’t really bother me too much at night with the drum of the room a/c and sound machines but my wife was often awake. We loved the location and the house was the cleanest we have ever rented but if I’m being honest, I’d never rent it again (sorry Boyd you were a wonderful host) it was just too loud for someone who lives in rural Virginia and has no traffic noise at their own home. City dwellers or people who live near roads should have no issue, I’m just used to only hearing birds and all I heard was cars.

We enjoyed the walks and neighborhood, as well as Hyde Park downtown. The only downside is it’s right next to the fwy and train tracks so sleep was difficult- even with sound machines he provides. However, beds were comfortable - which is important. Overall Boyd did his best to make this home comfortable, warm and inviting. He went above and beyond to help us make his home our home for the New Years Holiday! Fountain in back is a great touch! We enjoyed the home immensely. Great Holiday House for families!

review_text: My family stayed at Boyd’s Hyde Park home for my daughter’s wedding weekend. The house & casita were fabulous! The house is exactly as pictured, very clean, well appointed, and completely comfortable for a group of 8-9 people. The front porch is so nice, and the surrounding neighborhood is made up of pristine older homes with friendly people. It is totally walkable to the downtown Hyde Park restaurants and shopping. This area is a beautiful part of Tampa, very quaint. We did not have to contact Boyd about anything at all. The only drawback to the location is the proximity to the highway overpass. If you are sensitive to noise, there is traffic highway noise. Inside the house it was detectable, but not intrusive. It would not prevent me from renting there again as the home is wonderful and the nicest Airbnb I have ever stayed at.

review_text: Being very familiar with South Tampa, I knew this location would be ideal to take advantage of Tampa's incredible dining scene btwn biz meetings. The property is beside the highway/overpass so gave me some pause but was delighted to find that this thoughtfully designed and furnished home was very quiet throughout our stay & included many small touches that made the home very quiet, including: mature palm trees, insulated windows, water feature in back yard, white noise machines on bedside tables (never needed/used) and a large charming front porch facing the type of quiet beautiful tree lined street for which HydePark is known. Spacious & well-kept home has a "Restoration Hardware vibe" and offers every amenity one could wish for. Almost missed the separate AC unit in the mstr bedroom. Remember to bring/pick up a small container of laundry soap as washer/dryer is avail as well. Will rebook! Boyd very responsive. TV has it's own apps - will bring an Apple TV or ChromeCast next visit.

Amy's apartment was lovely! It was spotless and extremely well stocked. Kitchen had everything we needed and more. She even had filtered water in fridge.
The bed was very comfortable with soft pillows and quality linens. Bathroom towels were large and soft. She had everything from shampoo to a blow dryer. She even had a flat iron! Living room couch was comfortable, perfect for watching TV. She provided everything from an extra floor fan to beach towels and beach toys. Lovely location and close to everything.
Amy is an awesome host! Great communication from beginning to end! She made sure we had everything we needed, even stuff I thought I might have to ask for. I wish all my trips were as stress free as this one was. Definitely a 10 and would recommend! Can't wait to come back!

There were other thoughtful touches throughout, such as a shower cap and desk lamp with a wireless charger.
The neighborhood was quiet and pretty. We loved the garden under the window and watching the birds and small lizards fly and scurry around outside.
Amy also offered some beach gear, which was extremely helpful since we flew in and out of Tampa.
The location and amenities were perfect for our family, and made the whole experience better. We would definitely stay here again.

Besides that, Amy was also very responsive when we had questions about how to use the appliances in the house. We felt so welcome and comfortable during our stay. I love the decor in the Master bedroom, the TV with soft music and the whole aquarium were turned on when we arrived. The house was super clean and spotless and I highly recommend it for anyone who wants to visit Tampa. Thank you Amy for letting us to have the opportunity to stay at your cozy home!

Beds were fairly comfortable. Location was quiet. You do hear a lot of stomping from the upstairs neighbors but it wasn’t terrible. The only improvement I suggested was better lighting and mirror in the guest room. Getting ready for a concert with 3 women was kind of hard with the only good lighting being the guest bathroom and sitting on the floor for the mirror in the living room. I would have just brought a lighted-mirror and used the desk area in hindsight. But overall, I 100% suggest this place and would stay again :)

The location was great for us since we spent a day at each of the following beaches: Siesta Key, Clearwater and Madeira. Next time I am in the area I will be staying here again.

Prior to our arrival, the owner, Amy was helpful, efficient and reliable, which gave us confidence.
when we arrived, we were absolutely Amazed with what we saw! The home was spotless & clean and in every way exceeded our expectations...
We particularly liked the sense of a home away from home, as it was very comfortable and it had everything you could possibly need and more. The neighbohood was quiet and Beautiful.. The location was in walking distance to park & walking trail area.
Also close to a must try Eatery (Sal's Bodega) the Food was amazing!!!!" We had a wonderful time and thoroughly recommend this Airbnd. Will be definitely booking it again.... Amy was so thoughtful and responsive and she went above and beyond for us during our stay..
Amy even put up Christmas tree for my family
& blessed us with a amazing bottle of wine for Christmas Stay in tampa.
